text:
Hello there!
I’ve created an APP with my Developer account, and I’ve set the Webhook with “Event throttling” as 10 per minute.
After a few days, I’ve checked again the webhook and the “Event throttling” was set as 10 per second
Do you know if there is a specific reason for this change? thanks in advance
Did a V3 version of this API ever come out? <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/create_or_update>

Hello guys,

Anyone please help. Is there any way how to make the api fetched results not visible for everyone ? I want to make it visible to the owner only i have here the link which is visible :disappointed: <https://23917857.hs-sites.com/_hcms/api/contactdeals_new1>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>
no create or update tho huh :disappointed:
if you look at the endpoints there is create and update in there
yeah but not a create _*or*_ update
i.e. combined into one endpoint
there is probably a reason why it was split up, right?
yeah, to get you to spend more money on API requests
they're overcomplicating every API to make sure you consume as many API requests per day
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/blog/reducing-HubSpot-requests-utilizing-batch-api-and-graphql-for-better-optimization>
no mutations with graphql tho

<@U03PCH27EAV> How is this endpoint being called? Is it from a HubSpot UI Extension? Or some code within HubSpot? Is the user routed from another system to this endpoint? Is the endpoint used to gather data for use in another system?

Hello,

Has anyone had any issues with refresh tokens not coming back from HubSpot when either authenticating or any other scenario? I am having an issue where refresh tokens disappear and we are no longer able to retreieve a fresh access token.  I have not been able to reproduce locally and only seems to happen sporadically. Not sure if anyone else has seen this before.

Thanks!
how I can get my accounting appId?
Are there any endpoints for creating invoices (adding them to a contact)? I've been searching for awhile and can't seem to find any

I am using the HubSpot api ruby gem - and i’m trying to associate a file (which i have successfully uploaded via api) and a ticket (also successfully created via api) together so that the ticket shows the ‘attachments’ pretty much. does anyone know the easiest way to do this? It seems a bit tricky and the documentation isn’t the clearest around the ruby gem.
expanding on this - is there no easy way to just send a file with it to the file_upload property that exists on tickets?
